title: After 29 years, a veteran Microsoft Engineer admits "MS-DOS could do graphics," but the company opted for a lackluster UI — as Windows 3.1 runtime already checked the missing boxes
author: Kevin Okemwa
description: Microsoft employee Raymond Chen reveals why text-based setups were so common despite MS-DOS shipping with support for graphics.
cntitle: 29年后，一位资深微软工程师承认“MS-DOS可以做图形”，但公司选择了平庸的UI——因为Windows 3.1运行时已经满足了缺失的功能。
cndescription: 微软员工Raymond Chen揭示了为什么基于文本的设置如此常见，尽管MS-DOS支持图形。
